instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
threads.message:
No light on the MagSafe. But the mb is showing low battery logo on the screen after pressing the power botton. 
I discovered that f7005 is out, I replace it and it blew again after Pluged in charger. 
I removed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and replace another fuse. 
the orange light came on, I installed another <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> from a donor board, the orange light came on and <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> started getting very hot. 
I removed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> stopped getting hot.
pls what can I do next. Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
threads.message:
Possibly bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.
Check diode mode between <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>/50.
If short, change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
threads.message:
There is a short on <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> (0.001)
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, diode mode to ground on <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> now is (0.117).
but ppbus is still 1.1v.
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is getting very hot 
<TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is getting warm.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
threads.message: I said to check between the both resistors, not to ground!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
threads.message:
Ok  btw resistors is  516
But ol on switching probe. , note-this reading is without <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
After I Installed another <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> the MagSafe is flashing green light. 
ppdcin voltage goes up and down between 13v and 2v
Ppbus is 1.1v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> usually fluctuates when leakage is detected.
What happens with lab PSU, or fake charger?

Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
threads.message:
I expected these voltages with lab PSU.
Why would you want to check something which you know doesn't exist with original charger???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
threads.message:
Exact resistance between pins 27/28?
Check <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and their traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
threads.message:
0.028
<RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> 10.1k
<RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> 10.4K
With Lab psu I have ppbus and fanspin. 
The traces are good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
threads.message:
0.028 is close to expected value; should be 20 ohm.
However, <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>/21 can't have 10K each one; 10 ohm is other thing.
Please, post accurate information.

Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and test again with original charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead
